StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Pioneering

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants a free, fully loaded, colony ship.

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: Your people are eager to explore the stars, and more importantly, are willing to put up the credits to do it.

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Explorers

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: A previously unnoticed class 10 planet is revealed near your home system.

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our surveyors have found that a world that was thought to be barren is actually colonizable. The best part; it is quite near by.

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Abundant

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All new colonies start with 2 extra population.

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: A recent growth spurt coupled with people that are eager to experience new planets. Results in a pleasant increase to future colonizing.

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Adept

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Each existing colony receives 1 additional tile.

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: Our expertise in exploration and colonization has paid off again, by allowing us to find 1 additional usable tile on each of our colonies.

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Beacon

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants a class 16 planet.

StringTable.Label: OutreachTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: A reclusive world, long hidden from the rest of the galaxy, has decided that our civilization is a beacon of enlightenment, and worth aligning itself with.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Elevated

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the Elevation Foundation achievement.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: The Elevation Foundation encourages visitors to your civilization to assimilate more fully to your species' culture, boosting a colony's Morale by 100% and generating a Benevolent Ideology point every 5 turns.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Dignified

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Homeworld Approval increased by 50%.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Residents of your homeworld are so proud of its heritage that they don't seem to mind that it's also one of the most crowded worlds in your civilization.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Appreciative

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Your first 5 worlds receive an Approval bonus.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Descendents of the first colonists carry with them an unusual amount of pride and faith in your civilization.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Loyal

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All colonies receive a 10% Resistance bonus.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: Our citizens have grown to love our worlds, and will rise up in defense of them.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Noble

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All colonies receive a 50% Approval bonus.

StringTable.Label: AffinityTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: A government can enslave its citizens strength, and dominate their minds, but their hearts can only be won.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Eminence

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the building of a Missionary Center, which produces a Benevolent Ideology point every 10 turns.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: The Missionary Center will create missionaries that travel the galaxy spreading the word about the greatness of your civilization. This will grant powerful bonuses to Influence and build your reputation as a benevolent race.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Admirable

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Gives your home world an additional Influence per turn.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: The culture and standard of living on the homeworld civilization are admired and envied throughout the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Enticing

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All planets and starbases within our Influence join our civilization.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our reputation has grown to the point that any world within our Influence begs to join our civilization.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Alluring

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All starbases generate Influence, regardless of type.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: Our starbases glitter in the deep night of space like stars formed from glass and titanium.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Radiant

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All your worlds gain additional Influence per turn.

StringTable.Label: ProminenceTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: Our worlds are so prosperous and advanced that each and every one of them is idolized by the rest of the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Educated

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants 150 free research points.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: Your culture of open minded acceptance regularly encourages the development of great thinkers. One such mind has stepped forward, leading to massive advances in your understanding of the universe.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Skilled

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All your worlds gain a 10% Research bonus.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our starbases are the beating heart of our empire, through which blood flows to each part. They transport supplies and ships, but more importantly communication between our worlds so that our best minds may easily confer with each other.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Enriched

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the Temple of Enlightenment achievement.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Allows us to build a Temple of Enlightenment, which gives a 200% bonus to a colony's Research and generates a Benevolent Ideology point per turn.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Breakthrough

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants 300 free research points.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: Our civilization has become so attractive that great minds thoughout the galaxy have begun migrating to our worlds, beginning a new Golden Age of scientific advancement.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Quantum Leap

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants 600 free research points, and all colonies gain 5 Research per turn.

StringTable.Label: EnlightenmentTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: The advancement was so significant that we could not imagine what we were about to become, and once transformed we could not remember what we once were.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Prepared

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the building of a Preparedness Center, which produces a Pragmatic Ideology points every 10 turns.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: A Pragmatic people know it is better to be perpared for the worse, these centers alow our worlds to better cope with the harsh realities of the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Favored

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Anyone at war with us receives a 25% penalty to Approval.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our civilization is so highly thought of in the galaxy that any race which declares war on us will soon suffer a backlash from their own population.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Reserved

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Enemy ships in our Zone of Control receive a 25% penalty to their sensor and ship range.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our people have made it a habit of making sure that hostile races have a hard time getting around or even finding their way around our territories.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Cautious

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All planets receive 3 free defending ships.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: As the galaxy becomes more and more dangerous our citizens have become more capable of defending their own worlds, and have found the means to do so.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Watchful

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All our ships receive a free Escort fighter when in our Zone of Control.

StringTable.Label: VigilantTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: Our citizenry has become very protective of our infrastructure, and has formed several volunteer groups that patrol our territory protecting our fleets from attack.

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Constructive

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants 3 free constructor vessels.

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: We have established a number of public-private partnerships to encourage the creation of constructor vessels that will help us build out our infrastructure.

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Coordinated

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our shipyards operate at 100% at twice the distance from your colonies.

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Improved planning has made our shipyards much more efficient, dramatically improving the effectiveness of our economic and military infrastructure.

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Inventive

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: New starbases get one additional module to start with.

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our thrifty starbase engineers are so efficient that they can now build an additional module out of their construction supply.

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Resourceful

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All mined resource yields increased by 2

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: Our miners have been able to increase the yields of our starbases without any additional infrastructure.

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Efficient

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All Construction modules now give 2 points instead of 1.

StringTable.Label: BuilderTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: Our engineers have gotten so proficient at building starbases that they can now make two modules with the same resources it used to take to make one.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Exporters

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants a free freighter and trade license.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: With the proper infrastructure in place, we will be far better able to capitalize on the possibilities of interstellar travel.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Merchants

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All trade income increased by 25%.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Traders from our civilization are regarded as the hardest dealers throughout the galaxy, capable of getting the best price anywhere they travel.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Luxury

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Enables luxury trade routes.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Luxury trade routes are not only more profitable they increase the Influence & Approval of the planets they connect.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Indispensable

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Improves relations with civilizations we have trade routes with.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: Our trade routes have become so well established that the Civilizations we trade with will do almost anything to keep them going.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Shrewd

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Diplomatic trades for Credits pay an additional 25%.

StringTable.Label: TradersTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: Our skills as negotiators are so great that we are always able to ensure our civilizations comes out ahead in any trade.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Neutral

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: No one will declare war on us for the next 50 turns.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our civilization has established a reputation as one that can be reasoned with, and for the time being, we will be able to talk our way out of all conflicts.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Amiable

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Improve relations with all races.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our cautious but reasonable approach when speaking with our neighbors has established a reputation that will benefit us in all our diplomatic dealings.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Arbiters

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the building of the Arbitration Center achievement.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our reputation as a fair and balanced race has attracted attention from others, who wish us to help resolve their own disputes, increasing our reputation as a Pragmatic Race.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Popular

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Races that declare war on us anger all other races in the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: Our reputation as negotiators has grown to the point where even our enemies look suspiciously at anyone who declares war on us.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Venerable

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Any race that invades our homeworld is instantly declared war on by all other races not allied with them.

StringTable.Label: NegotiatorTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: Our homeworld has become known as the neutral ground throughout the galaxy, and violating it invites the wrath of most of the galaxy's races.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Militaristic

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants a free frigate class warship.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our race's intent interest in military research and development has resulted in the creation of a prototype ship that is truly ahead of its time.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Eager

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Every planet we conquer provides our people a permanent boost to Approval.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: With each victory, our forces become more sure of their cause, and more determined to do what is needed to achieve it.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Threatening

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants 5 free, fully loaded, transports.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our people are so hungry for conquest that they have privately funded and manned an entire invasion fleet.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Dangerous

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Unlocks Advanced Transport Modules that come with escort fighters.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: Our transport modules are now so efficant that they can carry escort fighters in case they are attacked.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Bloodthirsty

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All planets receive a fully armed Overlord class ship.

StringTable.Label: AggressionTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: Our civilization is so hungry for violence that each of our planets are able to muster up the resourses to fabricate a large defensive ship.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Intimidating

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Unlocks the Intimidation Center improvement, which produces a Malevolent Ideology Point every 10 turns.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: An Intimidation Center is capable of raising approval by force. When placed on a troublesome world, it will help shut up the whiners and reconfirm our reputation as a race that doesn't take sh... guff... from anyone.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Relentless

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Grants free Production to our homeworld.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Workers are meant for working, and after making a messy example of a few who thought otherwise, we can count on receiving a quite a boost to production on our homeworld.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Ruthless

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Doubles the Military production of our homeworld.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our hone world is so motivated to spread it's influence that the shipyards their can produce ships at twice the rate of almost any world in the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Implacable

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the building of the Death Furnace achievement.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: These terrifying Death Furnaces will make a planet substantially more productive, although quite a bit less pleasant to look at. It also generates a Malevolent Ideology point per turn.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Unforgiving

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All colonies receive a 25% Production bonus. Unlocks the Culling Planetary project.

StringTable.Label: MotivationTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: Since we began broadcasting our most hilarious and painful Laziness Sanctions throughout our civilization, workers everywhere live in terror of not giving 110%.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Uncharitable

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Provides a 10% increase to planetary income.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our planetary administrators have become experts at scraping a bit of revenue off the top of the economies of their worlds. A simple matter, really; anyone who complains soon finds themselves working in some dark and noisy place.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Utilitarian

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Improves the class of our first five worlds by 1.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our core worlds understand that land is meant to be developed, and that even the most marginal terrain must be exploited if our race is to maximize its productivity.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Tightfisted

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the building of the Citadel of Revenue achievment.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: The Citadel of Revenue is spoken of in whispers throughout the galaxy, though few know the techniques it uses to sqeeze every last credit out of a planet. Simply owning one generates a Malevolent Ideology point every 5 turns.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Slavemasters

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: All trade route now bring back slaves in addition to Credits.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: With a bit of creative management our traders have been able to begin importing slaves from forign worlds, most often without our trade partners noticing.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Heartless

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Each planet receives additional usable land.

StringTable.Label: GreedTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: So little does our civilization care about the plight of its workers, that we're able to make use of terrain once thought dangeously unusable.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait1_Name
StringTable.String: Scary

StringTable.Label: AweTrait1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: No penalty from sharing borders with another civilization.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait1_Dec
StringTable.String: Races we share a border with know better than to make an issue of it.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait2_Name
StringTable.String: Feared

StringTable.Label: AweTrait2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Minor races in our Zone of Control will trade more favorably with us.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our reputation now causes weaker races to humiliate themselves at our feet, begging for our favor with unreasonably generous trade terms.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait3_Name
StringTable.String: Unnerving

StringTable.Label: AweTrait3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Enemy ships in our Zone of Control suffer a 25% penalty to their Hit Points.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait3_Dec
StringTable.String: Enemy ships in our territory are so paranoid that they seem to literally shake themselves apart in fear.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait4_Name
StringTable.String: Exalted

StringTable.Label: AweTrait4_ShortDec
StringTable.String: A Class 16 colony near your borders defects to your civilization.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait4_Dec
StringTable.String: There are some worlds wise enough to know not to resist our splendor, regardless of what their leader tells them.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait5_Name
StringTable.String: Undaunted

StringTable.Label: AweTrait5_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our planets and starbases are immune to Culture Flipping.

StringTable.Label: AweTrait5_Dec
StringTable.String: Our people are so proud that the concept of yielding to a foreign culture is impossible to conceive, they will stay loyal until the bitter end.
